item.title: Trisha add a quote by Josh Gates
item.description: "Travel does not exist without home....If we never return to the place we started, we would just be wandering, lost. Home is a reflecting surface, a place to measure our growth and enrich us after being infused with the outside world." -- Josh Gates

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Amy Lignor
item.description: "The Gates of Heaven and the Gates of Hell are the same gates. It just depends which side you're standing on when you walk through." -- Amy Lignor

item.title: Trisha add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Not all those who wander are lost." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have found out that there ain't no surer way to find out whether you like people or hate them than to travel with them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Isabelle Eberhardt
item.description: "Now more than ever do I realize that I will never be content with a sedentary life, that I will always be haunted by thoughts of a sun-drenched elsewhere." -- Isabelle Eberhardt

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Why do you go away? So that you can come back. So that you can see the place you came from with new eyes and extra colors. And the people there see you differently, too. Coming back to where you started is not the same as never leaving." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Trisha add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Steve Maraboli
item.description: "The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday." -- Steve Maraboli

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "The most important reason for going from one place to another is to see what's in between, and they took great pleasure in doing just that." -- Norton Juster

item.title: Trisha add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Jacqueline Susann
item.description: "People parted, years passed, they met again- and the meeting proved no reunion, offered no warm memories, only the acid knowledge that time had passed and things weren't as bright or attractive as they had been." -- Jacqueline Susann

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious Ambiguity." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Trisha add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "Normal, in our house, is like a blanket too short for a bed--sometimes it covers you just fine, and other times it leaves you cold and shaking; and worst of all, you never know which of the two it's going to be." -- Jodi Picoult
